Issues.Title: System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when delete button control then click undo in DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 9.0: Main branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it works well in .Net 8.0 from Release/8.0 branch of Winforms repo. The original issue is [9412](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/9412).

### Issue description

In [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app of Winforms repo, System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when delete button control then click undo.
Actual result in DemoConsole application when **testing main branch**:

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/80c58b85-6df8-4d5b-acf7-2a7655cbc567

**Call Stack:**
System.NullReferenceException
  HResult=0x80004003
  Message=Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
  Source=System.Windows.Forms.Design
  StackTrace:
   at System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CodeDomSerializationStore.ComponentListCodeDomSerializer.DeserializeModifier(IDesignerSerializationManager manager, String name, Object state) in C:\test\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms.Design\src\System\ComponentModel\Design\Serialization\CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CodeDomSerializationStore.ComponentListCodeDomSerializer.cs:line 421

  This exception was originally thrown at this call stack:
    System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CodeDomSerializationStore.ComponentListCodeDomSerializer.DeserializeModifier(System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager, string, object) in CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CodeDomSerializationStore.ComponentListCodeDomSerializer.cs

Expected result in DemoConsole application when **testing release/8.0 branch**:

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/bcaf868f-1ff7-4f16-bbf5-942a3e1b1cfe



### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when delete button control then click undo in DemoConsole application" (#10096)

Issues.Title: [Announcement] Dreddy-work is signing off!
Issues.Body:
After having served as the repository owner and maintainer for the past year, I am embarking on a new chapter within Microsoft. This journey has been genuinely rewarding, and together, we have made great progress in advancing WinForms and nurturing a thriving community. WinForms has played a significant role in my Microsoft career, and I intend to continue contributing to this repository in a contributor capacity whenever the opportunity arises.

I'd like to express my sincere thanks to @lonitra for accepting the responsibility of taking over as the repository owner and maintainer moving forward.

Please don't hesitate to mention me in issues or pull requests where my input could be valuable.

Thank you, everyone!
Devendar

Issues.Title: How can I make my top-level bin folder contains only the .exes and .exe.configs, and all the interop dll's are neatly tucked away?
Issues.Body:
### Which files are affected?

I have a Winforms project running on .NET 6.0 in Windows 11.
It refers to some third-party dll, and they will be copied to ouputpath at build time.
How can I make my top-level bin folder contains only the .exes and .exe.configs, and all the interop dll's are neatly tucked away?
For example:
```shell
├─app.exe
├─app.config
├─app.deps.json
├─dll
│   └─a.dll
│   └─b.dll
│   └─c.dll
│   └─ ···
```

I tried to add an app.config file, like this:
``` xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?>
<configuration>
  <runtime>
    <assemblyBinding xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v1">
      <probing privatePath="dll;" />
    </assemblyBinding>
  </runtime>
</configuration>
```
But it does not work.

### Which languages are affected?

c#
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How can I make my top-level bin folder contains only the .exes and .exe.configs, and all the interop dll's are neatly tucked away?" (#10075)

Issues.Title: Enable nullability in DesignerActionPanel
Issues.Body:
Now that #10035 is merged, my plan is to annotate just `DesignerActionPanel`, and then rebase #9367 to remove the annotation changes I made on it there, but keep all the other changes with their review.

My changes here include the modification of the annotation of a public interface. The two internal implementers of method `IWindowsFormsEditorService.DropDownControl` cannot handle a null `Control` as argument, and nothing in the docs said the implementers should prepare for that scenario

## Proposed changes

- Enable nullability in `DesignerActionPanel`
- Update nullability annotations of interface `IWindowsFormsEditorService`

Issues.Title: Clean DesignerTransaction after DesignerTransaction committed
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #10082 


## Proposed changes

- Set DesignerTransaction to null after submitting CleanDesignerTransaction
- When there is no substantial positional movement of the internal control, cancel the DesignerTransaction directly to avoid _insertionIndex=-1 causing an exception in code line [while (_insertionIndex < _childInfo.Length - 1 && _childInfo[_insertionIndex].InSelectionCollection) ](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/e6d1ad98adb7825970935942de483273912c82f1/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/FlowLayoutPanelDesigner%20.cs#L593C8-L593C109)

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- All of the control can be selected normally in Demo project

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

- Manually

Issues.Title: After moving Button on the Manually Align Controls by hand page of the DemoConsole application, it fails to focus on component controls
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 9.0: Main branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

.Net 8.0 from Release/8.0 branch of Winforms repo without buttons

### Issue description

In the Align Controls by hand page of the [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test application in the Winforms repo, moving Button3 or Button4 and then clicking on component control, the component control cannot be focused and moved.

### Steps to reproduce

Actual result in DemoConsole application when testing main branch:



https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/108860782/e838fc43-2456-4b6f-8496-a2a5fcd843fe

Issues.Title: Add LabelEdit to TreeView
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #9956 


## Proposed changes

- Adding a shared control of LabelEdit for ListView and TreeView .
- Add LabelEdit to the TreeView.
- Update LabelEdit of ListView.
- Add test cases for LabelEdit of TreeView.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Label edit in TreeView has correct position in accessibility tree.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before
The LabelEdit control of TreeViewNode will be placed as a first child of the TreeView in accessibility tree.
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/133954995/4f773c62-d759-42df-a4a0-1016cd31d0e6)

### After
The LabelEdit control of TreeViewNode will place as  a child of the Editing TreeNode in accessibility tree. 
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/133954995/ad391bd3-223c-402f-9e0a-0e21e8631312)

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual (Insights, Inspect)

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

<!--
     Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible. 
     WinForms has a key role in allowing developers to create accessible apps. 
     
     When submitting a change which impacts UI in any way, including adding new UI or
     modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the Accessibility Insights
     tool (https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and verify that there are no changes or
     regressions. 
     
     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide
     a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.
     More info: (https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/en/web/getstarted/fastpass)
  -->


 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- 9.0.100-alpha.1.23504.14


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->
